website_summaries.verdict: The minimalist Vapor Glove 2 is built for fast trail running.
pros: A true minimalist trail shoe with a sleek look and glove-like fit
Although there's little cushioning, the shoe does protect from trail debris and is extremely lightweight
Great for those who want a barely-there shoe

customer_reviews.title: Partner loved these shoes, until....
customer_reviews.text: ...they completely fell apart in a matter of months. He absolutely LOVED these, don't get me wrong. We typically only wear Vivobarefoot shoes, but at the time couldn't afford to shell out for their tennis shoes. I wish I would have taken a picture before we threw them out! I mean, totally destroyed. And he's not even someone who is hard on shoes! So, for how much he loved them (and how affordable), we're into lasting products. Would much rather save for quality. We do now, we have switched back to only buying Vivo's and Softstar Shoes (and amazing handmade, barefoot shoe company out of Oregon). Would not recommend these, just save for better quality!
customer_reviews.author: Malissa Parker

customer_reviews.title: decent and look good
customer_reviews.text: These are the same kind of "barefoot" shoe that used to be sold, but with a regular toe box. No arch support and the soles are pretty thin, making them very light and comfortable to wear. But no way I'd want to trail run with them unless the trail were paved or had wood chips to soften the landing. A trail of rocks and roots will hurt your feet after a short while. But they're great "around the house" shoes, as well as great general workout shoes, and I also wear them in the water and kayaking. Gotten compliments on their look, too. So overall great unless you want to actually use them for their named purpose.
customer_reviews.author: pencatthing

customer_reviews.title: Good Shoe!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair, so it's fair to say I like the shoe (in spite of the garish colors) -- I like it's fit and I like it's construction, and I like that the sole is heavier and thicker than my other barefoot shoes (Fitkicks and Vivobarefoot). Sometimes I don't want to feel every rock on the trail or every crack in the sidewalk. I'd give it a solid 5 stars if they offerd it in adult colors.
customer_reviews.author: Curt Schatz

customer_reviews.title: BEST SHOES EVER
customer_reviews.text: I'm in love with these. Perfect fit plenty of toe room but snug everywhere else. People are complaining that it's too thin but I laughed because it was actually more protection than I expected! What babies! Lol these are the perfect amount of protection, more than enough not uncomfortable EVER!!! I run and walk on rocky trails, road, and hike in forests with these. CAUTION: the left shoe dug into my Achilles' tendon when I first got them. Worried me a lot. But I realize now they just had to be broken in!!! They are perfect now. If they do this for you, try breaking them in first.
customer_reviews.author: Fen

customer_reviews.title: Very soft glove-like shoe.
customer_reviews.text: A lot more pliable than I was expecting - more like a slipper. I'm used to the NB Minimus which is thin and low-profile but still has structural integrity. Sole is VERY flimsy. Laces and eyelets are a bit chintzy. The "Black/CastleRock" color has a lot more blue undertones than appeared in the picture. WOuld be a great shoe for boating. kayaking, climbing trees, yard work, etc. I purchased because the tread is perfect for a flat pedal MTB shoe but the sole is just way too soft/flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: M. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Works even for Hawaiians!
customer_reviews.text: I am Hawaiian. And growing up in Hawaii, and not really wearing shoes very much until I was in my twenties and my haole wife forced me to. LoL. Seeing is it that we grew up without shoes our feet are naturally very wide. None of our toes touch. New Balance 4E is the closest shoe I have ever found that sort of fits. Until now!!! These shoes are a Heaven Sent for me and my wide feet. I can now walk around all day long without being in pain. I can't wait to put them on every day. I feel like a kid again!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: keala nakanelua

customer_reviews.title: Way too long/big.
customer_reviews.text: Had to return the shoes. I've always fit tight in size 11 shoes from many brands including Merrell, but when my foot was where it was supposed to be the was an extra whole inch between the back of my foot and the back of the shoe. They would slide like crazy if I were to run in these. I think If it fit me Id be giving it 4 or 5 stars, so look for an update if I decide to buy another pair. I do like the design and I can tell the changes they've made trying to improve it and it seem promising, as long as it fits. But until then I cant say for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Flood

customer_reviews.title: Great minimalist shoe
customer_reviews.text: This is a good running shoe. It's also become my travel shoe, being small and easy to pack. I travel very light, especially for international travel. These shoes are comfortable for day walking and for running. Like most minimalist shoes, there is an adjustment period and a person will have to adapt and adjust his/her walk style and stride (for running). The shoes came with a small instruction card from Merrell for advising on how to acclimate your feet and lets to using these shoes. I now have 3 pair of this shoe, each pair a different colour.
customer_reviews.author: MazdaMan

customer_reviews.title: My favorite shoes
customer_reviews.text: I only run when chased, so this is more from the perspective of having feet and liking minimalist footwear. I love these things. Supremely comfortable with virtually no break in time required. They're a little more cushy than my Vibrams while still feeling firmly connected to the ground (i.e. no "I'm walking on mattresses" feeling), and they have the confident grip of Vibram tread material. They're especially good for people like me with longer second toes than thumb toes, causing toe shoes to never fit quite right. I'm typically size 9 or 9.5 depending on the shoe, and a 9 in these fits perfectly (with socks).
customer_reviews.author: Tobin T. Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Soles of feet sore 3 weeks later after one day walking in these!
customer_reviews.text: So uncomfortable! I wore them in the house to break them in like I do all shoes and they felt good. Wore them out for a day of shopping and the soles of my feet are still hurting badly! I know they are " trail running" but good grief stepping on a rock would flat out injure your foot in the bottom of these! Wish I had not wore them outside cause now I can't return them and am stuck with them! I have been a fan of Merrell boots and sandels for almost 2 decades and these are worse then a pair of Walmart water shoes as far as comfort!
customer_reviews.author: Skillet82

customer_reviews.title: Big (toe) Problem
customer_reviews.text: Very early into use, the big to area on the right shoe seems to have 'fragmented,' leaving an uneven sole. Feels like it was cracked, and now runs into my big foot any time pressure is added. Also, the sides of the shoe seem disintegrate quickly. Not recommended...
customer_reviews.author: jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, lightweight shoe
customer_reviews.text: I first ordered these in black so that I could wear them without drawing as much attention to them. I found them to be so comfortable that I ordered them in orange as well. They are very lightweight, keep your feet cool, seem to be well built, and have good traction. If you are someone who has a heavy step, I would probably not recommend these. I know the shoe is meant for trail running, but I wear them for every thing, including to work. Keep in mind, the fact they are barefoot shoes means you will feel everything you step on.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last long...
customer_reviews.text: These were my husband's second pair of Merrell running shoes and although they seemed nice, they just didn't seem to be made as well as his first pair and they didn't last as long either! He was kind of disappointed as he loved his first pair of Merrells!
customer_reviews.author: Heidi

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: It started deteriorating on the sides after 6 months. While I enjoyed the feel of the ground these are not good for long distance running, because of durability. I will wear them until they fall apart but I don't think I got the bang for the buck. I wear 10 casual, 10.5 athletic. 10.5 fit like a glove, not tight. I recommend you go a half size bigger than usual. You WILL feel it if you try going through rocks/gravel with these. I advise you run on smooth tracks, roads or paths. Stay off rough trails. Edit: My picture will not upload :(
customer_reviews.author: Gabe R.

customer_reviews.title: so I had a pretty good idea what I was getting
customer_reviews.text: This isn't my first pair from this series, so I had a pretty good idea what I was getting. I mostly use them when I am kayaking -- they are light and flexible which makes getting into the cockpit a bit easier, and they don't retain water (not that they keep my feet dry -- they just don't have much by way of fabric and padding to hold the water in). I have also found that they are really comfortable to use as driving shoes for long trips, though the funky color scheme looks a little odd with my otherwise staid wardrobe.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: got a 10 in these and they fit perfect for a running shoe which is to say plenty ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm usually a 10, got a 10 in these and they fit perfect for a running shoe which is to say plenty of toe box room. These shoes are the best for ground feel, take your time adjusting to them, but there is really nothing better. I prefer to wear without socks, and they breathe great. Also, these shoes are head and shoulders above the "knock off" version of them you may have seen (also for sale on Amazon.) I tried the knock of version myself and they weren't comparable in fit or quality, not even close. These are great shoes for running as well as casual.
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: Honestly I've never been this disappointed in a new pair of shoes in my life
customer_reviews.text: I've been buying Merrell shoes for years. This is my 6th pair of Merrells. I haven't had them a month and the fabric is tearing on the inside and outside of the right shoe and the toe cap area of the soul is starting to separate from the rest of the shoe. There is also a ton of exposed glue where the soul meets the fabric of the shoe. Honestly I've never been this disappointed in a new pair of shoes in my life. The one positive thing I can say is they are comfortable. I will be contacting Merrell directly to see what they are willing to do to rectify this situation.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just the basics
customer_reviews.text: wear a women's 11 bought a men's 9 for the width and colour. Great minimal. Find the sole is a bit slippery when wet, going from grass to sidewalk they squeak. No padding or insole so I can feel the texture of uneven ground, lumps, rocks etc. My left lace always unties. To get them tight enough across the mid-foot - in front of the arch - I have to pull tight but then they're to tight across the arch... Still playing around with lacing. Nice an light fabric, dry quickly when they get wet. Now I don't have to explain my minimal footwear as they don't have "toes" to them.
customer_reviews.author: sheryl

customer_reviews.title: Great minimalist shoe
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes. My mom says I totally wrecked my first pair of shoes even though they were totally fine after my older brother was done with them. I killed each pair of these in about 5 months, but continued to beat them after that because I was broke at the time. I am not sure if it's possible to makes something so minimalist any more durable, but these things wear out maybe 10-20% faster than other shoes I've owned at the same price point. If I have a pair of shoes in any decent kind of shape after 6 months that is a miracle.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler J. Eickholtz

customer_reviews.title: or if you are very happy running in traditional shoes with no injuries
customer_reviews.text: Fit as expected. This shoe has the same type of thin sole as the vibram five-finger shoes without the toe pockets. I have worn holes through three pair of those over the years and am looking forward to wearing these out. If running heel first is your thing, or if you need any kind of cushion or support, or if you are very happy running in traditional shoes with no injuries, then you should probably stick with what works.
customer_reviews.author: TexLex_photo

customer_reviews.title: Good idea. Terrible execution.
customer_reviews.text: Man. I had high hopes for this show. They just didn't materialize. Great in theory. Reality it didn't pan out. The sides of the shoe are so paper thin that they barely lasted through 90 days of regular wear. Any bump to the shoe takes away at the exterior fabric and leaves behind a vulnerable web-like fabric that doesn't take much to finish off. I currently have a irreparable rip down the outside of my left shoe that renders them useless. Pretty disappointed in this shoe from a reputable shoe company.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip & Whitney Gable

customer_reviews.title: Great product, however too narrow, discontinued within a month.
customer_reviews.text: Great product, great feeling. They run true to size. I was skeptical with the size and bought 9.5 as per their measuring method. The first run was 4.5 kilometer and felt amazing! This is my second barefoot shoe, first one was Vibram Five Fingers. Loved this Merrell so much, already planning to buy another pair next month. Update after few weeks, few runs: the shoe really is very narrow, I use normal D width for all shoes, but this one does not give any choice; developed pain on both sides of my big toes, discarded in less than a month. Otherwise it is a great product!
customer_reviews.author: Zuk..

customer_reviews.title: Great fit, maybe slight too thin of a rubber sole, but odor control is a problem...
customer_reviews.text: Great fit for someone with a narrow heel and widish at the toes... I thought the rubber sole was just a bit on the thin side comparing it with my NB M020's which were my first zero drop trail runner; they don't sell anymore but they were excellent... I really am having a lot of trouble with foot odor... even with cotton socks on it would get rank after wearing them all day... it just seems like the only material I can wear that doesn't get rank is leather unfortunately.
customer_reviews.author: Obadiah Crowley

customer_reviews.title: Sleek Exercise Shoes
customer_reviews.text: I am a big fan of minimalist shoes. I purchased this pair of Merrell for exercising on treadmills and elliptical machines. They fit my feet very well, and are very comfortable. I like their contemporary look. I have one small complaint. The back of the heel is a bit stiff and takes some time to break in. I initially used wore no profile socks which did not provide enough protection from rubbing by the new shoes before break in. Then, I switched to regular socks, and that prevented further discomfort.
customer_reviews.author: A. Silverstone

customer_reviews.title: Good for walking and running on roads, will not last more than 3 runs on the trails
customer_reviews.text: For the price, they're not completely terrible. The biggest complaint is that they are not robust at all. For road running they work fine, and for dirt roads they're fine too...but so are any pair of running shoes. The reason I got these was for a good pair of trail shoes, but these were destroyed after a few trail runs. I recently took them on my first few trail runs and haven't put more than 30 miles in trails, but they have already developed holes and several other minor tears. I wouldn't purchase them again for trail running. It makes more sense to invest in a durable pair rather than buy these often.
customer_reviews.author: Cristopher Garduno

customer_reviews.title: Excellent fit, very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I used to wear the Barefoot Trail Glove by Merrell, and was disappointed to learn that the current version is changed. I bought these because they're most similar to the original Trail Glove. The fit was perfect--same size as my Trail Gloves was just right. They may be flatter than the trail gloves: I've had some soreness in my calves as I adjusted to them. MUCH less than with my previous pair, because I was already used to "barefoot" shoes, but a little. I love these shoes in every way. I'll update later to report how they hold up--my only other concern is whether they'll last like my previous pair.
customer_reviews.author: Leonard R Budney

customer_reviews.title: Barefoot minimalist concept is new to me.
customer_reviews.text: A little snug in width, but that was expected considering wide width not available. This shoe is super light and flexible, very easy to pack for trips. It feels great in the gym, but that is a padded floor. I am not much for running outdoors so I cannot fairly comment on that aspect of performance for this shoe. However I feel you will need to change your running style if these are your first minimalist shoes. The flat no cushion soles would really rock you if you have a hard heel strike running style. Overall I like them a lot, time will tell if barefoot style is right for me.
customer_reviews.author: Delaware Mad Dog

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend if you are looking for a minimalist shoe and ...
customer_reviews.text: Got this to replace a worn out Trail Glove 1. Based on reviews of the Trail Glove 3(only model available), and trying it in a Merrell store, the Trail Glove 3 wasn't for me. Tried on a Vapor Glove 2, and got the light, flat minimalist shoe I was looking for. No arch riser to give issue to running, and it was on sale on amazon as well as the store. Thinking about getting another pair just in case what happened to my Trail Glove 1 happens again. Would recommend if you are looking for a minimalist shoe and don't need the protection offered for trail running
customer_reviews.author: Pryoplasm

customer_reviews.title: Great exchange process, and an amazing shoe!
customer_reviews.text: I had to send back the original pair because I ordered slightly large based on other reviews, but once I replaced them to the size I normally wear they fit perfectly. The exchange process was super simple, and super fast. I had the new ones before the old ones ever got back. I absolutely love them. I have worn essentially only Merrell shoes for almost 15 years, and these ones have not disappointed either. I was a little worried when I couldn't find the same ones I had before, but these have been every bit as excellent. I truly am a Merrell fan for life.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: True to size for me and like a VFF with a toe box!
customer_reviews.text: Will update if opinion changes or they wear out unexpectedly fast. I found the shoes to run TRUE to size. I ordered a half-size down based on other reviews and had to return for my normal size 9. For reference, I wear 9s in VFF, Adidas, Stacey Adams, Rockport, Asolo, and Belleville & McRae combat boots. They feel very much like my VFF - but with an enclosed toe box. I took them for a walk tonight and love them. The blue/green color combo looks great.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for parkour!!!  Grippy, comfortable and true to size.
customer_reviews.text: My 14 y/o son has x-wide flat feet and these fit him perfect. They remind me of water shoes, which is why I do not think foot width makes a difference. He also wears a 12 in regular shoes and these fit him perfectly. He loves parkour and enjoys wearing them while jumping, climbing, balancing, flipping on/off everything outdoors as well as indoor courses.
customer_reviews.author: R. Chastain

customer_reviews.title: Started tearing apart less than a month in :(
customer_reviews.text: Both shoes developed a tear on the outside seam in less than a month of light use (see picture), maybe only 30 miles on them. I've been running on two pairs of the version 3's of these for over a year (over 500 miles on each), and they are starting to break down on the inside which seems more reasonable. I loved the lighter feel of the 2's and the more flexible sole, however it's effectively useless... Currently using duck tape on the inside to get a few more miles out of them. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Seabury

customer_reviews.title: Foot Massagers
customer_reviews.text: This is just my second pair of minimalist running shoes, but I do prefer them to my previous pair. They wear like gloves, but a rocky trail feels like a foot massage rather than a painful ordeal. I can't speak to the durability of the shoes since I've only taken them out on a handful of runs so far, but they appear to be well-made. I find myself looking forward to the next run. In the opinion of this minimalist noob, they're awesome. Edit: Well, now that I've owned these for a bit I have to revise my review. Like other reviewers, my shoes have begun to rip--in the same place as all the others.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: This shoe is like running in slippers
customer_reviews.text: This shoe is like running in slippers. It seems to be well made but I live in a neighborhood with pavement and cement sidewalks and I need something with at least a little bit of cushion. I also have trails where I live but the trails I run on have rocks and roots and this is not the shoe for that kind of trail. I would suggest this shoe for running on the beach or running in grass.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe, I bought these to use in the gym without cushion during deadlifts and squats, they work great! Grippy sole and awesome air circulation. They are super light so it's almost like your not even wearing shoes! I did play some football with them and they didn't dissapoint. Kept me running on the balls of my feet vs using my heels. Whenever they wear our I'll get another pair. My wife hates the color though.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: These are great minimalist running shoes
customer_reviews.text: These are great minimalist running shoes. Previous to these I had New Balance trail minimus shoes. I liked those shoes a lot, but a new pair was going to be very expensive. These had great reviews, so I tried them out and they are great. They have the thinnest soles I have ever had. If you are not used to running in minimalist shoes, start with walking, or maybe short distances, or you will be hurting.
customer_reviews.author: Gabi

customer_reviews.title: Go .5 smaller than usual size.
customer_reviews.text: Go .5 size smaller than usual tennis shoe. I wear a 9.5 EE and against others suggestions, I purchased the 9.5. It was too big, but was super simple to return and I immediately purchased the 9. It fits well. I've not worn it a lot, so not sure if it's going to stretch out since I have wide feet. So far, I've liked them. Light and simple. I'm not used to wearing shoes with no support, so taking it slow so not to hurt myself. Love the look as well.
customer_reviews.author: Todd C

customer_reviews.title: realize that these shoes need to break YOU in.
customer_reviews.text: So even with socks, I'm down 1 size with these guys, but I knew that from trying on trail gloves at REI so I put them as "somewhat large". They have no arch support which is, you know, the point. it also has no padding or differential. These are excellent hiking shoes, will make your feet and calves very strong and even though I'd NEVER trail run with minimalists before, I ran at full speed with no foot pain afterwards... though my calves were utterly destroyed (because I'd actually be running normally for the first time perhaps ever). I have no issues now. These train you to walk and run properly -- that is, on your forefoot, as designed.
customer_reviews.author: Manuel Noriega

customer_reviews.title: Very cool
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes with no bells and whistles. Has great traction on the sole and are super lightweight. Only thing is the color isn't as grey as it appeared on the picture, has a lot of green and blue in it which was a slight disappointment but doesn't take away from the quality. I'll definitely be buying them again if I should need to
customer_reviews.author: Morte Masks

customer_reviews.title: Barefoot Bliss
customer_reviews.text: LOVE these shoes. I was never a runner before I discovered barefoot-style shoes. Running was always a painful experience for me, but after I tried running in a previous Merrell barefoot-style shoe, I will never run in anything else again. These shoes are even better than that first pair. They are lighter and are even closer to what I imagine actually running trails barefoot would feel like. These shoes do wonders for my running. I do have a hard time finding good fitting shoes, but Merrell has never let me down. I have several other pairs of Merrell shoes and would recommend them to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Awesome minimalist shoe, short lifespan
customer_reviews.text: I've had these for 16 months, and worn them for most of my gym training sessions and regular walking shoes. I'll admit I put them to the test doing a lot of body weight strength training and some running on asphalt and concrete. The tread is just now starting to disappear. Te major issue as seen in the photo is the tearing and hole on the lateral, outside edge of the shoe in the toe box happening on both shoes. Very unfortunate. I was hoping that paying this much for a minimal shoe, they would have lasted at least 2 years. Otherwise, I love how lightweight and flexible these are. I'll probably go for Feiyue tai chi shoes next.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Mutch

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Great light trail shoe. Although it fits well in length, it is a little narrow on the toes and not very suitable for experienced bare foot runners who have expanded their toes. It feels good on the road but I wouldnt recommend them for rocky trails. They dont have much grip and kinda have a flip-flop feel. Its great as an every day shoe and light trail running. But if you wanna go all out and dont care what ppl think, go with Vibram five fingers (pretty much any model) if you wanna feel like a ninja Tarahumara!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Took a chance
customer_reviews.text: Just used these a couple hours ago for some interval training and Nordic Track Cross-country cardio; instantly comfortable, and though I usually take an "E" width I didn't notice any extra tightness in the arch or toe regions. I took a chance due took the great price and plan on using them for jogging when I work up to it-curious about the barefoot running style as it makes sense one's power is generated from a strong and sturdy foundation...plus they look cool. Try them out; Merrell makes great products.
customer_reviews.author: filanges

customer_reviews.title: These shoes are incredible comfortable, but their durability is virtually nonexistent
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are incredible comfortable, but their durability is virtually nonexistent. They are the only pair of Merrell shoes I have ever owned that started to break down with a few weeks of owning. I do walk a lot, and spend a lot of time on my feet, but I wore through these shoes, both feet, in an incredibly short time for Merrells. I'm used to a pair of their shoes being a daily shoe for most of a year, if not longer, and these fell apart in under three months. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: W. Spaedt

customer_reviews.title: These will be the only shoes you ever wear to the gym
customer_reviews.text: BEST SHOES IVE EVER OWNED!! I own about 100 pairs of sneakers. Half training shoes and the other half running shoes. These are now the only ones I wear. They are comfortable, light, and look great. People always ask about them.
customer_reviews.author: Javadca20

customer_reviews.title: Normally I love Merrell shoes and especially more minimalist style shoes but ...
customer_reviews.text: Normally I love Merrell shoes and especially more minimalist style shoes but i have to say i was dissappointed that this pair seemed to break down pretty fast. The vibram outsole is great but the upper has ripped and torn in multiple locations and this was only using them for walking around campus for less than two months. I used to sell hoes at Dicks Sporting Goods and have been an avid runner for years but I can tell you these fell far behind a typical 5 month or 500 mile life of you average running shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Brendan Hurley

customer_reviews.title: Work horse
customer_reviews.text: I purchased my vapor gloves in December of 2015 and am now replacing them a year later. I generally run between 15 and 20 miles per week. These are the only shoes I run in and I have used them in conditions from 100+ summer weather in South Florida to -15 in the Minnesota winter. The did develop small holes as other people have mentioned but they did not ever expand to the point that made the shoes unwearable. I love these shoes. I had the original vapor gloves and have loved the whole line from the start
customer_reviews.author: BigYouth

customer_reviews.title: Best Shoes for Your Feet
customer_reviews.text: Best Shoes for your feet. The perfectly thin some and wide toe box encourage naturally healthy for strength and positioning. They're comfortable and provide protection from anything sharp or hard, but have none of the cushioning that would encourage bad running technique. Want to buy them again even though they're still in great shape.
customer_reviews.author: BeantownDutch

customer_reviews.title: Better than original Trail Gloves
customer_reviews.text: After wearing out my original Trail Gloves I went looking for a minimalist shoe to replace them. Merrell added cushioning to the Trail Glove 3 so the Vapor Glove is now their truest barefoot shoe. I'm very happy with these so far and use them for everyday wear and running on hard surfaces. The sole is extremely flexible and thin so it feels like you're wearing nothing at all. They are a little roomier than the original Trail Gloves which I like because now I can wear socks with them.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonShopper

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight shoe that is an Improvement on Vapor Glove 1
customer_reviews.text: These are my second pair of Vapor Glove shoes. I had the Vapor Glove 1's and though the 2's would be an improvement. I like the larger toe box in the 2's as it gives my foot some room to spread out when my toes hit as I am a fore foot striker when I sprint and mid foot when jogging. I have been wearing these to run on pavement and on trails. You can feel quite a bit through them but has made me more aware of foot fatigue while running and has increased my foot and ankle strength. I also wear these shoes to weight lift because they are lightweight and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel I.

customer_reviews.title: He has flat feet so not all shoes work for him and he is just getting over a torn hamstring so good shoes are even more importan
customer_reviews.text: My husband runs 5-10 miles daily as well as doing crossfit/weightlifting. He had a pair of Merrells (different style) he had worn out after 8-10 months of hard use and wanted another pair that could go the distance across all of the physical activity he does. These seem to fit the bill. He says it's important to break them in slowly so they form correctly to your feet. He has flat feet so not all shoes work for him and he is just getting over a torn hamstring so good shoes are even more important. He is always pleased with Merrell and after trying Nike's in between, he came back to the Merrells.
customer_reviews.author: Mountainmama

customer_reviews.title: ... an older pair of these shoes that are in better shape than these
customer_reviews.text: I have an older pair of these shoes that are in better shape than these. The new version does not hold up very well. I've only used these in the gym and to run on pavement. I'd expect them to last longer than they have.
customer_reviews.author: Jboy

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable & true to size for me (10D
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable & true to size for me (10D, my feet are on the narrow end, though). They've held up well so far, my first minimalist running shoe. My back & ankles feel amazing for a change after over a decade running in "normal" "motion control" shoes. But don't think you won't feel little rocks on the trail (like bigger than 3/4inch diameter)... yeah... hurts. Maybe I'm a wuss but I try and keep these strictly for road/track running or trails without big pebbles.
customer_reviews.author: J. Ko

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. This is my second foray into minimalist shoes. I am hoping that they'll help with foot pain due to flat feet as well as knee pain. I walk at least 3 miles a day, and these have been very good so far. As expected, you get almost no cushioning in the soles, so you will feel whatever you are walking on. This has led to some moderate soreness in the heels and balls of my feet, but it seems to get better as my body adjusts to walking in a different (natural) way. Only complaint is that they are a tad wide in the foot box. If I were running in these, it would be problematic.
customer_reviews.author: d

customer_reviews.title: Terrific shoes. Not for everyone, but anyone who prefers to be barefoot...
customer_reviews.text: These are tremendous shoes, assuming you appreciate the feel and benefits of running/walking as close to barefoot as possible. They are extremely lightweight and durable. Expect to feel the pavement or terrain beneath your feet, including any and all pebbles -- which is precisely the point. I found years ago that the newer running shoes, with extra padding "for comfort", actually had a poor effect on my feet and shins. Give these a try. If at first they seem "different", allow your feet to adjust and toughen a bit before making a final decision.
customer_reviews.author: MJM13

customer_reviews.title: Truly minimalist shoes
customer_reviews.text: Many shoes that claim to be "barefoot" style or "minimalist" aren't really minimalist enough. This one is about as minimal as you can get without looking weird. If you're looking for a shoe that feels like you're wearing a sock with a thin layer of rubber for a sole, this is the one for you. You will feel every tiny twig you step on, and you definitely won't want to use these while running on gravel. Shown in the photo next to the much less barefoot feeling Trail Glove 3.
customer_reviews.author: Yanni

customer_reviews.title: Great barefoot shoe!
customer_reviews.text: I've never worn a shoe before that actually fits like a glove. This is a true zero-drop barefoot shoe with no arch support and very little padding between my foot and the ground. I need a little bit of padding, and this one has just barely enough. The soles are sticky from day one, making it easy to balance on beams, rocks, etc. and to stick to walls in a cat hang. The style and color appeal to me as well. Best shoe for obstacle course training and parkour I've tried yet--though I'm a beginner and don't have much experience with either the shoes or the sport.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not Durable
customer_reviews.text: These shoes aren’t durable. After a little more than a year of light wear the sole has started to separate from the top material. The soles show little wear. I’m not a runner, I wear them mostly for walking and hiking. The money would be better spent on three pair of a lesser brand, or by spending a little more on a better brand.
customer_reviews.author: Dean

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe when it’s not wet outside.
customer_reviews.text: Rubber on the side of the sole is very low and gets feet wet very easily! Rubber sole is really just on bottom of shoe and only rises a 1/4” To 1/2” on sides and anything than a light rain, your feet will definitely get wet. Comfortable to wear, East to put on and take off. Very breathable & light weight.
customer_reviews.author: Roadtripn42

customer_reviews.title: Definitely a minimalist shoe, but comfy and well made
customer_reviews.text: It was a Merrell so I expected it to have a thicker, more absorbing sole but it's a Vibram sole, the ultimate " minimalist shoe, e.g. don't count on it to protect your feet against shocks. It does shield it against gravel and pointy stuff in alphalt though. I wore 5-fingers before my foot accident, so I wanted to get back to minimalist shoe though a bit better padded than 5-fingers, and this is actually a pretty good fit.
customer_reviews.author: MN

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes for travelling and running
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes. This is the second pair I have bought, the first having served me well for a long time. I don't wear them all the time but I find them to be a great travelling shoe, good for light day-hiking, and for running (again usually when I'm travelling and use them instead of taking multiple pairs of shoes).
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Too big
customer_reviews.text: There's much to like about the Merrell no-rise shoes. I have a previous minimal shoe from Merrell that I loved and ran/walked it into the ground. But this one came way too big (at least compared to my previous one and my Nike running shoes). Because they were too big (mostly in width, especially in the toe and ball of the foot, rather than length), it was hard to judge its support, but it seemed to be less "fitting" than I'd expect from a shoe named "glove". Anyway, I returned them and decided not to try a smaller size.
customer_reviews.author: S Pooley

customer_reviews.title: Fits like a glove but make sure to order one size down
customer_reviews.text: especially if you are used to New Balance minimus like me. Fortunately, these Merrells do fit like a glove with full lace up. Heels are snug without feeling cramped or too tight. But these shoes run large; with size 11, there is clearly an inch in the toe. Despite that, I can lace fairly tightly without discomfort and run just fine. Be warned however that sole is quite thin and you will feel every pebble or gravel. Being a trail shoe, it should be just a tad thicker. If NB minimus ever goes back to their original design, I would likely go back.
customer_reviews.author: groundie

customer_reviews.title: I love these. I replaced my Vibram 5 Fingers with ...
customer_reviews.text: I love these. I replaced my Vibram 5 Fingers with these to work out in...because they look so much better and are easier to put on.. After a while I bought another color to wear around town, because I like the way they feel. I haven't had to go through my old stretching routine to avoid plantar fasciitis pain since I rotated Vibrams and these Merrells into my work out and warm weather shoe lineup.. I can't explain it, but I wear them all over the place, on all kinds of surfaces and they are comfortable all day long.
customer_reviews.author: Stanfx

customer_reviews.title: Great work out shoes.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing work out shoes. Best for indoor but can certainly be used outdoors as well. They run slightly large but honestly a little large is preferred over too small. There are no areas of friction against toes or feet. Very comfortable and the grip/traction is perfect. The shoe is mesh on top so there is no issue with perspiration. I use mine without socks and I feel like I'm bare foot and I love it. I've been tempted but have yet to wear them while bike riding. Maybe some day.
customer_reviews.author: 1FrSF

customer_reviews.title: Best Shoes Ever
customer_reviews.text: Best shows I have ever owned! I realized quite a bit ago that shoes with too much cushion at the heel destroyed my run time and form. After making the switch to flat/minimal shoes I have never enjoyed running quite as much. I can run faster and my form doesn't falter. It does require some adjusting, as any significant changes do, but the texture of the shoes and how it's put together is like no other. Still wear them to this day and I'll wear them casually too. I have since purchased some of Merrell's other shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian

customer_reviews.title: Modern Samurai Footwear
customer_reviews.text: These are the best shoes for multiple activities. I do a lot of Barefoot training ,so these fit like a glove. I've used these for walking, soccer practice, heavy bagwork, and solo fencing. People that go to the gym could benefit from wearing these. Durability isn't an issue, because even Samurai would consider their shoes disposable. Merrell is a great company, the only improvement is releasing a High Top version.
customer_reviews.author: Augusto Morales

customer_reviews.title: GREAT FIT, STYLE, & FUNCTIONALITY
customer_reviews.text: was just a bit concerned buying shoes online as I have a kind of hard to fit foot. there was a little questionnaire i filled out before ordering these--general questions about how shoes tend to fit me. i ordered size 11 1/2 based on the information provided--which was completely accurate! the shoes themselves are great--like wearing nothing but protected.
customer_reviews.author: SatyaZawaski

customer_reviews.title: Amazing minimalist shoes!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes!! I was looking for minimalist shoes that resembled 5 fingers in their functionality and came across these. I am a fitness coach and am on my feet all day long so I need shoes that are comfortable and durable, and these are both!! The only thing is that I dont have much cushion on the bottom of my feet so I have to put 2 insert cushions in these to prevent the bottoms of my feet to get bruised.
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: Too narrow!!
customer_reviews.text: I am a woman with wider than average feet, but I heard that Merrell's run narrow, so I decided to order the mens instead of womens. These are SO NARROW. If you have wide or even average feet, these probably are NOT going to fit you! I had to return them immediately.
customer_reviews.author: purplesugar

customer_reviews.title: minimalist shoe my husband loves on his feet literally all day.
customer_reviews.text: First, know this is a minimalist shoe. My husband works on his feet all day. His coworker has a pair and recommended them to my husband. My husband has been wearing his pair daily and loved them, so this is his 2nd pair, in a different color. He keeps one pair at work. Now, my husband says there are 3 other nurses or techs who are wearing them, too. My husband has totally flat feet and I thought these would be bad for him, but it's just the opposite. He has always worn Clarks or Rockports at work and likes these much better.
customer_reviews.author: Wine Country

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Hiking Shoe!
customer_reviews.text: I fell in love with Merrell Trail Running Shoes a couple of years ago, and I am still in love with them. I don't like the heavy feel of a hiking boot when I go hiking, and I wanted something other than a sneaker to wear in the woods. I found Merrells, and I haven't looked back. They are a very light-weight shoe, with just enough cushion in the sole not to weigh you down. I am very happy with this item!
customer_reviews.author: PRISMISSPP

customer_reviews.title: Sweet!
customer_reviews.text: Thinner than I expected, these soles have moccasin-like protection and weight. They are light and easily packable, plus a nicer shoe appearance than the five finger style. I owned a pair of five finger shoes, and was surprised at the similarities in feel, obviously not the fitted toes, but in regard to foot-strike. I usually wear an 11.5-12, so I ordered a size 11 to compensate. The shoe actually fits fine and tight, but I have some space around my toes. This space really has no negative effects having hiked 5+ miles in Utah terrain.
customer_reviews.author: jrodgers

customer_reviews.title: As minimal as Vibram Five Fingers, but with Toe Protection!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a huge fan of minimalist shoes. I used to wear Vibrams but they live little protection for your toes and I just kept bruising them too often. These shoes offer almost all the same minimalism as Vibram Five Fingers, but with that sturdy piece of rubber in the front adding just a bit of a crumple zone for toe stubbings. I love these shoes! Absolute best and most minimal non-toe-shoes I've found on the market. In fact I find the sole to be more minimal than many models of Vibrams. First time I put these on: they hurt on gravel in a way I'd never experienced with Vibrams! My feet had to toughen up further.
customer_reviews.author: jubishop

customer_reviews.title: Larger then expected but good product.
customer_reviews.text: Mine were too large and I'm currently replacing them for 7.5. I usually wear 42 (8.5) with everything with the tight foot feel. Rock climbing shoes, other merells, my five finger shoes. These were the first to be off by I'm thinking a full size. Other then that the craft looks solid and well made. I'm excited to see how they hold up. I'll mostly use them as my everyday outside shoes. I use 5 finger shoes for my actual everyday runners. I will update after I receive them and give them a proper using.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Merrell Vapor Glove 2; Super shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I have had an do have several models of Merrell shoes. My new Vapor Glove 2 are super, just did 7 miles combo on black top dirt and gravel. There cut a bit looser than my other models, can use light soxs, or bare feet. Vibrum soles give very good tracction and protection. Great color options. Mine are the hot orange with silver gray. They were delivered to my address in box inside sealed plactic pouch, in just 4 days.
customer_reviews.author: bodyworks2010

customer_reviews.title: I like the product
customer_reviews.text: I have regular proportions and am an Adidas size 9.5 US. I bought the 9.5 initially. Too long (with no socks). I reordered the 9.0. I didn't want to pay or go through the small hassle of reordering again. I am 90% sure the 8.5 is the size for me, hence the rating. Otherwise, I like the product. I use it for ladderwork, short runs (7 min/mile or less) on the treadmill, jump rope,and heavy bag work as the university gym frowns upon bare feet. I wouldnt recommend the bag work for kicks, as the sole has so much traction it impedes the twisting of the planted foot.
customer_reviews.author: IRIS

customer_reviews.title: you feel like you are running on bare feet
customer_reviews.text: getting the size right is trickier than i thought. i bought this shoe as my running shoes and i normally wear size 8.5, so i ordered 8.5 first and it was too long, so i ordered size 8 and it is still a little long. Also, the bottom of the shoe is extremely thin, when you run on these shoes, you feel like you are running on bare feet. Overall, i guess the vapor glove 2 is a nice and comfortable shoe as long as you can get the size right, which can be tricky, since there is no way for you to try them on if you don't go to an actual store that has this particular shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin D

customer_reviews.title: might as well call it a swim shoe!
customer_reviews.text: I have to be very unhappy with a product to give it a "1" star and take the time to write a negative review. However, I believe its truly warranted and in no way is this a "running shoe" No cushioning and uncomfortable! It felt like I was literally running with nothing but socks on! If you want to use them at the pool or beach...sure! Running...NO!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Michael C. Selitto

customer_reviews.title: Really good shoe. True minimus shoe
customer_reviews.text: Really good shoe. True minimus shoe, but not an everyday shoe. I want to say I have had them for about 4 months give or take mine is already falling apart on the outer edges where the pinky toe would be (sole is beginning to separate from the part it is glued to). I would buy this shoe again if it was only strictly for running where you want and then switching to shoes/sandals to preserve its life if you plan on going somewhere after your run.
customer_reviews.author: ilovefruits

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic shoes with a short lifespan
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are excellent but the lifespan is short. They are light weight, breathable, comfortable, minimal shoes. I have not ran in any shoe like it and I am soooooo dishearten with the new changes (Vapor Glove 3???). Every time I see these shoes in my size, I buy as many as I can. Merrell, bring these back!
customer_reviews.author: Bmblebee2001

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: Per other reviews I ordered a size up from my normal (13-14_ SO they fit perfectly. The guide how to walk/use them is helpful as well for those who have little experience wit the "almost barefoot" style of shoe, what these are. The front of the shoe is WIDE to alow you to spread your toes out/Strong foot stance. Have not worked out in them yet, still getting used to them but so far I am enjoying using them for every day errands and driving.
customer_reviews.author: EnragedGorilla

customer_reviews.title: Great Pair of Runners
customer_reviews.text: I have worn traditional shoes all my life. I put a ton of research into minimalist running (and even barefoot) which ultimately led me to this pair of Merrell's. I was expecting to have to tough out a few weeks of running with the transition, but wow, after one run I am impressed. I literally felt slightly less effort with each stride, which certainly adds up over the course of a run. I am usually pretty tired after my runs but I felt good after this one. Merrell is on top of my next pair of shoes wishlist.
customer_reviews.author: D. M. Arykson

customer_reviews.title: Awesome shoes, but doesn't last very long
customer_reviews.text: I love this shoes. I bought them before I bought one in Amazon. It feels nice and light. I use it for running 3-4 times a week for 2-3 miles run. The only reason that it doesnt get five stars is that the shoes doesn't last very long. My last one lasted only 7 months before it has holes. I ran on the road and I switched from Vivobarefoot hoping this one would last longer. Maybe that's just a barefoot shoes thing that it can't last very long. I am somewhat surprised given the total mileage is not much. As a comparison, my prior non-barefoot shoes lasted for 3 years under the same usage.
customer_reviews.author: MD

customer_reviews.title: The color of the product received is different from the one advertised.
customer_reviews.text: The color of the product received is different from the one advertised. I attach the photo where you see the difference of what is shown on the Amazon page and what I received as a product. As a comment or recommendation, they should be more careful with the color distortion that is generated when taking the photo that does not capture the actual color creating a wrong expectation in the buyer.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Vapor Glove Is Best Glove
customer_reviews.text: Of all the Merrell "Glove" lines, I think Vapor Glove is my favorite. I've tried the other flavors and this is the best for everyday wear, in my opinion. The Vapor Glove 2 is a good improvement on this particular line, and I like the color choices much better. Can't tell you about the wear so far, but I get about 5 months of wear out of a pair of these types of shoes normally, with everyday use. I do not run in them, so this is just walking, gym and some light hiking.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Repp

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe
customer_reviews.text: Best "Minimus" shoe since New Balance stopped producing them. Ran 4 miles in them the first time ( I am an experienced minimus runner, having used New Balance Minimus for years) and these shoes performed excellently. Really like them and will order another pair today just in case Merrill decides to stop production of their Minimus shoes. Can't understand why the barefoot running concept has not caught on. I believe everyone could benefit if they approach the transition to barefoot running slowly allowing for the body to adjust.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great comfortable fit.
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes. The sizing is as I expected, running closer to what I understand my size to be. I usually look for a 13.5 or 14 in Altras, but 13 works perfect for me in these. I've been wearing them casually over the past two weeks and have started running short distances in them (~2 miles on a treadmill). So far so good. No issues. Update: Two months in and the shoes are holding up incredibly well. I'm up to 4-6 miles in them on runs. Have worn them for all day casual things like 14 hour days at Universal Studios in Orlando as well without any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Brown

customer_reviews.title: Kinda ugly
customer_reviews.text: These were just not my style. They fit well enough and felt OK while wearing, but the color was not true to the picture on amazon's website, and instead of being a muted grey-ish color, they were almost a bright blue. Returned them.
customer_reviews.author: Sam R.

customer_reviews.title: I enjoy them.
customer_reviews.text: There is space in the end of the shoe for my toes. Some people would say it makes it to big but if it was tighter it'd be uncomfortable for me to wear. But I really enjoy these shoes. They breathe well and if they get soaked in the rain they dry fairly fast and they are comfortable. I did buy a pair that I had to return because they weren't manufactured correctly but the pair I got to replace them are perfect so I can't complain.
customer_reviews.author: LadyLover

customer_reviews.title: Don't know why these were smaller than the other set of 10.5 Vapor Gloves purchased.
customer_reviews.text: Merrell makes very good shoes and I have another set of Vapor Glove 2 shoes and love them a lot, use them to run all the time. These are going to end up at Salvation Army once I have a big enough batch of clothes to run over there.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Ellington

customer_reviews.title: No problems so far
customer_reviews.text: I've only used them for a week or so and that's not long enough to speak of their durability, which quite a few people seem to have issues with. But the fit and comfort are perfect. We'll se how they hold up after a couple months but for now, I'm definitely impressed with the lightweight and flexibility.
customer_reviews.author: Simon

customer_reviews.title: Holes wore through sides in 3 months...
customer_reviews.text: Usually Merrell shoes hold up for a while for me, as I wear them at my full-time job and the last pair lasted close to a year, but these only lasted about 3 months before holes wore through the sides on both shoes. I'm not really rough with them, they are super comfortable and help you build strength back in your feet, and correct your form, but they should hold up longer than that for the price. Went back to Merrell water shoes, hopefully they last a while.
customer_reviews.author: William Guinter

customer_reviews.title: Ripped easily after only a few months.
customer_reviews.text: At first I liked these shoes a lot. They were comfortable and with the rubber toe they seemed durable as well. Unfortunately both shoes have holes in them after just 2 months of running in them.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Overall I really like these shoes
customer_reviews.text: Overall I really like these shoes, but after the second pair split in the same spot after just ~300 miles, they will be my last. The soles are fantastically thin giving you great connection with the ground; however, they're definitely thin enough to feel any pebbles you come across. I'm moving on to the Xero Z-Trek in search of something that lasts longer. Aside from the fabric splitting, I also found them to be very slippery on wet pavement.
customer_reviews.author: calebthebrewer

customer_reviews.title: Great minimalist running shoes, but wish they came in Wide sizing
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my husband, since he's blown out of his previous barefoot Merrells. He really loves the color of these and the completely minimalist style profile (0mm drop and 0mm cushion). My only complaint with these (and it's really not the shoe's fault) is that they don't come in a 13 wide anywhere. The 13s fit in the length, but are too small on the sides, he's only had these for a few months and the sides are already ripping on the inside (due to his giant hobbit feet). I really wish the barefoot style Merrells were offered in Wide sizing.
customer_reviews.author: Booknerd28Top Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Great for wide feet
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes and have bought them each time I wear through them. I use them almost exclusively and for everything I do. They last me about 6 months. My feet are wide and these shoes have given me comfort for years. I think I’m on my 6th pair, now. I do wish they would hold up a little better, but I can’t complain given how much I use them. They are currently out on Amazon, so... going to try something else for once.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Smallwood

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes, be careful on the fit.
customer_reviews.text: These run a little long but other than that fit well. It's a great minimalist running shoe - one of the few I've found that keep the minimalist feel but still allow you to run on hard or rough surfaces without discomfort. My only issue with the shoes is I wish they would size them more conventionally - I can never tell from one pair to the next what size will fit. These are half a size smaller than my last pair and still too long.
customer_reviews.author: charles david hood

customer_reviews.title: Great minimalist shoes
customer_reviews.text: I love the minimalist feel of these shoes. These shoes are extremely thin and can easily be folded in half. Do not buy these shoes if you are looking for cushion and or support. I wear the shoes all day teaching and they feel fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Storm

customer_reviews.title: Like wearing moccasins!
customer_reviews.text: Most comfortable athletic shoe I've ever had. I use them for strength workouts at the gym because they give you the feeling of being barefoot. I also have a few long plane trips in my future so I am planning to use them as a travel shoe that can accommodate swelling in the feet when you are up in the air for a long time. They also look really nice. I may buy another pair just to be sure that I have a "next pair" before they discontinue this model.
customer_reviews.author: Davo

product_meta.title: Merrell Men's Vapor Glove 2 Trail Running Shoe
product_meta.description: This featherlight trail shoe liberates your run with zero-drop ground contact. The breathable mesh upper molds to your foot for an uninhibited stride.
feature_bullets: Low-profile trail runner featuring lace-up vamp and pull tab at counter
Breathable mesh and thermoplastic polyurethane upper
